poem:
### Inspections Revised

In classrooms where red pens linger,  
words sharpened against the quiet,  
ghosts of chalk dust gather  
in bureaucratic rows.  
Grades recast, reshaped—  
like clouds caught in static mosaics,  
and echoing halls listen  
to polished whispers,  
all left to measure  
a past already vanished,  
where learning quietly shrinks  
in corners shadowed by endless scrutiny.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
